segment.name: Beginning of message
segment.documentation: BGM, A segment by which the sender must uniquely identify the order status enquiry by means of its type and number and when necessary it's function.

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, A segment specifying general dates and, when relevant, times related to the whole message. The segment must be specified at least once to identify the request date. The Date/Time/Period segment within other Segment group should be used whenever the date/time/period requires to be logically related to another specified data item e.g. Reference issue date is specified within the RFF Segment group.

segment.name: Information required
segment.documentation: IRQ, To indicate which information is requested in the responding Order status report message.

segment.name: Free text
segment.documentation: FTX, A segment with free text information, in coded or clear form, used when additional information is needed but cannot be accommodated within other segments. In computer exchanges such text will normally require the receiver to process this segment manually.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 1: A group of segments identifying the references with associated information

segment.name: Reference
segment.documentation: RFF, A segment identifying the previous messages related to this message.

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, A segment specifying the date/time related to the reference.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 2: A group of segments identifying the parties with associated information.

segment.name: Name and address
segment.documentation: NAD, A segment identifying names and addresses of the parties, in coded or clear form, and their functions relevant to the proposed order. Identification of the sender (normally the buyer) is mandatory for the enquiry. It is recommended that where possible only the coded form of the party ID should be specified.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 3: A group of segments giving contact details of the specific person or department within the party identified in the NAD segment.

segment.name: Contact information
segment.documentation: CTA, A segment to identify a person or department, and their function, to whom communications should be directed.

segment.name: Communication contact
segment.documentation:
COM, A segment to identify a communications type and number for the contact specified in the CTA segment.
4.1.2 Detail section
Information to be provided in the Detail section:

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 4: A group of segments providing details of the individual requested order(s).

segment.name: Document/message details
segment.documentation: DOC, A segment giving references to the purchase order(s) enquired. Other references may also be given, e.g. sellers reference number.

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, A segment specifying the date/time related to the reference.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 5: A group of segments providing details of the individual requested order(s) lines.

segment.name: Line item
segment.documentation: LIN, A segment used to identify a line item.

segment.name: Additional product id
segment.documentation: PIA, A segment providing additional identification on the product specified in the LIN segment. E.g. To give seller's item number, EAN number, technical specification number.

segment.name: Item description
segment.documentation: IMD, A segment for describing the product as well as product characteristic. This segment should be used for products and services that cannot be fully identified by a product code or article number.

segment.name: Measurements
segment.documentation: MEA, A segment enabling the physical measurements of the ordered item to be specified where this is required for full identification of the product. Any measurements must refer to the product in its unpacked form e.g. thickness of plastic film, length, weight, etc.

segment.name: Status
segment.documentation: STS, This segment is used to specify the reason why an order status enquiry is being made for to the current product.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 6: A group of segments giving references related to the order line(s) and, where relevant, its dates.

segment.name: Reference
segment.documentation: RFF, A segment giving references to sellers reference number, contract numbers, etc.

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, A segment specifying the date/time related to the reference.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 7: A group of segments used to request the status of only certain delivery of an order line.

segment.name: Place/location identification
segment.documentation: LOC, A segment indicating the location to which goods are to be delivered. This segment will only be used for multi destination deliveries.

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, A segment specifying the date/time related to the product quantities.

segment.name: Quantity
segment.documentation: QTY, A segment identifying the product quantities.
